title: Senior Health Informaticist
content:
Reimagine the infrastructure of cancer care within a community that values integrity, inspires growth, and is uniquely positioned to create a more modern, connected oncology ecosystem. 
We’re looking for a Senior Health Informaticist to help us accomplish our mission to improve and extend lives by learning from the experience of every person with cancer. Are you ready to be the next changemaker in cancer care?
What You'll Do
In this role, you'll provide domain expertise to guide the design and implementation of Flatiron’s data interoperability capabilities. Your contributions will help to accelerate Flatiron’s ability to meet regulatory requirements for OncoEMR and to develop data driven solutions for Community Oncology Practitioners.
This position will be the informatics subject matter expert responsible for building and validating standards-compliant data exchange capabilities, including prioritizing development work and identifying and mitigating areas of uncertainty and risk. In addition, you'll also:

Collaborate with other informaticists, clinical subject matter experts, designers, and engineers to improve data flows and data structures to support data exchange requirements
Partner with product management to identify interoperability use cases and clarify their value to our practices and patients
Identify appropriate strategies to test and validate data exchange capabilities, including data-sensitive functionality and semantic translations
Clarify the What and the Why of FHIR and other interoperability standards and their nuances to cross-functional teams, including team leads and implementers 
Proactively identify and highlight opportunities for informatics involvement early in product development 
Maintain active involvement in industry groups (EHRA, AMIA, HL7, etc.) to identify emerging best practices and bring to Flatiron opportunities for transformative changes 

The Health Informatics team is responsible for improving the integrity and use of patients’ health data with a focus on the point of care by leveraging and applying industry standards. Utilizing such standards, the team works from ingestion through the end-user experience to ensure safe, effective, and accurate transmission of healthcare data. 
Who You Are
You are an Informaticist with a deep understanding of EHR development, modern healthcare interoperability standards and logical data modeling. You likely have a clinical background with strong technical ability. You are able to work effectively in a highly cross-functional environment. You have a passion for healthcare data, are kind and collaborative, and are excited to help improve and expand data interoperability at an EHR. 

You have 5+ years of informatics experience, including implementations of standards-based interoperability capabilities, preferably FHIR
You have the ability to translate standards and interoperability concepts to an audience of non-informaticists (engineers, clinicians)
You have an understanding of healthcare related data elements
You understand the industry landscape and challenges, and how interoperability standards are evolving to help address them  
You have excellent command of technology to allow deep understanding of the lifecycle of data within an EMR environment
You are self-motivated and able to identify areas of opportunity and deliver high-value contributions 

Extra Credit

You have an understanding of oncology-specific data elements
You have clinical data translation experience (i.e. laboratory, genomic, or other)
You have strong ties to industry informatics groups (AMIA, HIMSS, HL7, etc.) 
You have a clinical background (MD/DO, NP, PA, etc.)

Where you’ll work
In this remote position, you have the freedom to choose your preferred work location while aligning your working hours with your team's. For further details on our hybrid work approach and remote work type, please visit the how we work website.
Life at Flatiron 
At Flatiron Health, we offer a full range of benefits to support you and your loved ones so you can focus your working hours on improving cancer care and accelerating cancer research, and your non-working hours on everything else life has to offer: 

Work/life autonomy via flexible work hours and flexible paid time off
Comprehensive compensation package
401(k) contribution to help you reach your retirement planning goals
Financial health resources including 1:1 financial advice
Mental well-being tools and services 
Parental benefits and policies including family-building care and generous leave
Path to parenthood programs supporting fertility, adoption and surrogacy
Travel support for safe healthcare services
Lifestyle spending account for perks that make sense for you and your family

In addition to our robust benefit offerings, visit our Life at Flatiron page to learn how we support continuous learning through professional development programs and celebrate Diversity in the workplace.

At Flatiron, we strive to build and maintain an environment where employees from all backgrounds are valued, respected, and have an opportunity to succeed. From several Employee Resource Groups (ERGs) to regular internal reporting on our D&I metrics to constantly investigating new ways to connect with underrepresented populations, we have embedded diversity into every corner of our hiring process and employee experience. As part of that, we encourage candidates to voluntarily complete the following survey which helps us keep track of how we’re doing in our efforts to achieve an equal seat at the table for everyone.

Information collected as part of this survey:

  • Is completely voluntary
  • Is anonymous and does not have any bearing on your application
  • Is measured in aggregate only (for use in anonymized reporting related to our DEI efforts).

Thank you for your interest in opportunities at Flatiron. When creating a profile and submitting your application, we will collect the following categories of personal information: direct identifiers, such as your name and contact information; professional information, such as your previous employment, education background, and work authorizations (e.g., work visas); and other information you include in your resume, cover letter and other job application materials, such as your preferences, skills, abilities, and references. We also may collect your social media information if you connect your social media account to your application. 

We use each category of the information you provide to evaluate your candidacy for the job opening(s) that you apply for and other job openings at Flatiron that we think may interest you. We may, in certain instances, transfer this data to third-party platforms so that we may better evaluate your candidacy (e.g., to compare your application to a broader candidate pool). We also use each category of information for other business purposes, including to comply with federal and state laws requiring us to maintain certain records, to manage our workforce, to detect security incidents, and to protect against fraudulent or other illegal activity.

For more information about how we use your information, please visit our Privacy Policy.
